members.name: air
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in Adobe AIR.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.air )
    alert( 'I\'m on AIR!' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in Adobe AIR. ...

members.name: chrome
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in Chrome.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.chrome )
    alert( 'I\'m running in Chrome!' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in Chrome. ...

members.name: cssClass
members.doc:
A CSS class that denotes the browser where CKEditor runs and is appended to the HTML element that contains the editor. It makes it easier to apply browser-specific styles to editor instances.

myDiv.className = CKEDITOR.env.cssClass;
members.short_doc:
A CSS class that denotes the browser where CKEditor runs and is appended
to the HTML element that contains the editor. ...

members.name: gecko
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in a Gecko-based browser, like Firefox.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.gecko )
    alert( 'I\'m riding a gecko!' );
members.short_doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in a Gecko-based browser, like
Firefox. ...

members.name: hc
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running on a High Contrast environment.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.hc )
    alert( 'You\'re running on High Contrast mode. The editor interface will get adapted to provide you a better experience.' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running on a High Contrast environment. ...

members.name: hidpi
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in the HiDPI environment.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.hidpi )
    alert( 'You are using a screen with high pixel density.' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in the HiDPI environment. ...

members.name: iOS
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running on Apple iPhone/iPad/iPod devices.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.iOS )
    alert( 'I like little apples!' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running on Apple iPhone/iPad/iPod devices. ...

members.name: ie
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in Internet Explorer.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.ie )
    alert( 'I\'m running in IE!' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in Internet Explorer. ...

members.name: ie6Compat
members.doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in an IE6-like environment, which includes IE6 itself as well as IE7, IE8 and IE9 in Quirks Mode.
members.short_doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in an IE6-like environment, which
includes IE6 itself as well as IE7, IE8 and IE9 ...

members.name: ie7Compat
members.doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in an IE7-like environment, which includes IE7 itself and IE8's IE7 Document Mode.
members.short_doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in an IE7-like environment, which
includes IE7 itself and IE8's IE7 Document Mode. ...

members.name: ie8Compat
members.doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in Internet Explorer 8 on Standards Mode.
members.short_doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in Internet Explorer 8 on
Standards Mode. ...

members.name: ie9Compat
members.doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in Internet Explorer 9 on Standards Mode.
members.short_doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in Internet Explorer 9 on
Standards Mode. ...

members.name: isCompatible
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in a compatible browser.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.isCompatible )
    alert( 'Your browser is pretty cool!' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in a compatible browser. ...

members.name: mac
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running on Macintosh.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.mac )
    alert( 'I love apples!'' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running on Macintosh. ...

members.name: mobile
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in a mobile environemnt.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.mobile )
    alert( 'I\'m running with CKEditor today!' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in a mobile environemnt. ...

members.name: needsBrFiller
members.doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in a browser which uses a bogus <br> filler in order to correctly display caret in empty blocks.
members.short_doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in a browser which uses a bogus
<br> filler in order to correctly display ca...

members.name: needsNbspFiller
members.doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in a browser which needs a non-breaking space filler in order to correctly display caret in empty blocks.
members.short_doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in a browser which needs a
non-breaking space filler in order to correctly display...

members.name: quirks
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in a Quirks Mode environment.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.quirks )
    alert( 'Nooooo!' );

Internet Explorer 10 introduced the New Quirks Mode, which is similar to the Quirks Mode implemented in other modern browsers and defined in the HTML5 specification. It can be handled as the Standards mode, so the value of this property will be set to false.

The Internet Explorer 5 Quirks mode which is still available in Internet Explorer 10+ sets this value to true and version to 7.

Read more: IEBlog
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in a Quirks Mode environment. ...

members.name: safari
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in Safari (including the mobile version).

if ( CKEDITOR.env.safari )
    alert( 'I\'m on Safari!' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in Safari (including the mobile version). ...

members.name: version
members.doc:
Contains the browser version.

For Gecko-based browsers (like Firefox) it contains the revision number with first three parts concatenated with a padding zero (e.g. for revision 1.9.0.2 we have 10900).

For WebKit-based browsers (like Safari and Chrome) it contains the WebKit build version (e.g. 522).

For IE browsers, it matches the "Document Mode".

if ( CKEDITOR.env.ie && CKEDITOR.env.version <= 6 )
    alert( 'Ouch!' );
members.short_doc: Contains the browser version. ...

members.name: webkit
members.doc:
Indicates that CKEditor is running in a WebKit-based browser, like Safari.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.webkit )
    alert( 'I\'m running in a WebKit browser!' );
members.short_doc: Indicates that CKEditor is running in a WebKit-based browser, like Safari. ...

members.name: isCustomDomain
members.doc:
Indicates that the browser has a custom domain enabled. This has been set with document.domain.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.isCustomDomain() )
    alert( 'I\'m in a custom domain!' );

return.name: return
return.doc: true if a custom domain is enabled.

members.short_doc: Indicates that the browser has a custom domain enabled. ...

members.name: secure
members.doc:
Indicates that the page is running under an encrypted connection.

if ( CKEDITOR.env.secure )
    alert( 'I\'m on SSL!' );

return.name: return
return.doc: true if the page has an encrypted connection.

members.short_doc: Indicates that the page is running under an encrypted connection. ...
